name: Watchy
mes: Hello Gira! What can I help you with today?

name: Gira
mes:
(index):12 Uncaught (in promise) Error: Ziggy error: route 'login' is not in the route list.
    at new u ((index):12:12462)
    at Proxy.<anonymous> ((index):12:17881)
    at Proxy._sfc_render (BhHeader.vue:42:18)
    at renderComponentRoot (runtime-core.esm-bundler.js:914:44)
    at ReactiveEffect.componentUpdateFn [as fn] (runtime-core.esm-bundler.js:5649:57)
    at ReactiveEffect.run (reactivity.esm-bundler.js:190:25)
    at instance.update (runtime-core.esm-bundler.js:5763:56)
    at setupRenderEffect (runtime-core.esm-bundler.js:5777:9)
    at mountComponent (runtime-core.esm-bundler.js:5559:9)
    at processComponent (runtime-core.esm-bundler.js:5517:17)

Where would the route list be, what name would it be and what's a good example of what adding that route would look like?

name: Watchy
mes:
*Watchy's holographic interface flickers, a sign that it's processing the information.*

Ah, I see you're dealing with a routing issue in your Vue.js application. The error message indicates that 'login' is not listed in your routes file.

The routes are usually defined in a `router.js` or `routes.js` file located in the root directory of your project or under a folder named 'router'.

Adding a new route would look something like this:

```javascript
{
  path: '/login',
  name: 'Login',
  component: Login,
}
```

In this example, `/login` is the URL path for this route, `'Login'` is its name and `Login` refers to the component that will be rendered when navigating to this route.

Remember to import the 'Login' component at the top of your router file:

```javascript
import Login from '../components/Login.vue';
```

After adding this code and saving changes, try accessing `/login`. It should now display whatever content is within your Login component!
